subject: Fwd: Foreign sounds (was Re: Maps in Quikscript)
msgSnippet: I would also note that Quickscript already has a couple of letters dedicated to foreign sounds (designed for Celtic languages in particular): [x] and [K].  I
messageBody:
I would also note that Quickscript already has a couple of letters dedicated to foreign sounds (designed for Celtic languages in particular): [x] and [K].  I have effectively used the former for transcribing Spanish names, and the latter for names in the Aztec language Nahuatl (which has the affricate [tK]).

While Quickscript is designed and well suited for writing English, it's entirely possible and useful to be able to use it for transcribing other languages as well.

-Benjamin Bruce
